summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding travel approval requests for federal agents and attorneys to conduct victim interviews and meetings in Florida and Los Angeles as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail logistical planning, approvals, and government travel policies.

connections.description: Both are part of the same investigative/prosecutorial team traveling for victim interviews in the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Travel for Florida Victim Interviews
events.description: Travel planned for a combination of team members (M and S) to Palm Beach, Florida for victim interviews in the Epstein case, with a request to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Approval for Los Angeles Travel
events.description: Travel approval granted for the investigative team to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in the Epstein case.

events.title: Request for Florida Travel
events.description: Travel request submitted for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Approval for Florida Travel
events.description: Travel approval granted for the team to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Initial travel request by S for travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for meetings and interviews in the Epstein case (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618).

keyFacts: The document reveals active federal investigation (case 2018R01618, United States v. Epstein) into Jeffrey Epstein for enticement of minors for sexual activity in 2019.
Federal agents and prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were traveling to Florida and Los Angeles to conduct victim interviews.
Travel requests indicate a pattern of investigative work involving multiple trips to Florida (Palm Beach, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and one to Los Angeles between March and July 2019.
The team routinely requested to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, suggesting formal interview settings.
The correspondence shows internal government travel approval processes and logistics for a sensitive investigation.
